meta.title: An Overview of the Initial Wheel

nodes.body: The first teaching was given at Deer Park in Sarnath, India. The content is the teaching of the Four Noble Truths and the philosophy that, while the self lacks a truly existent nature, phenomena have such a nature. It corresponds to H카nay훮na. The Four Noble Truths are: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path. The aim is that sentient beings should seek liberation from cyclical existence. While teaching that all people lack any inherent self, these texts do not critique the notion that phenomena can be established in their own right as the base of linguistic reference and conceptualization. The intended H카nay훮na disciples are Hearers and Solitary Realizers, who do not have separate wheels of the teaching because Solitary Realizers can attain their paths in reliance on the Hearers' division of the teaching.
